elements.title: Frederick Solomon (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that composer Frederick Solomon adapted several British pantomimes into Broadway musicals, including The Sleeping Beauty and the Beast (sheet music pictured)?

elements.title: Raoul Augereau (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that although his leg was shortened by 5 cm (2.0 in) following a battlefield injury, Raoul Augereau continued his military service?

elements.title: Mixtotherium (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the extinct genus Mixtotherium, meaning 'mixed beast', has traits of both extinct primates and hyraxes?

elements.title: Sean Jackson (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that before Sean Jackson won three Ivy League basketball championships, he won high school state championships in both baseball and basketball?

elements.title: his action of setting himself on fire (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Aaron Bushnell said that his action of setting himself on fire was less extreme than "what people have been experiencing in Palestine at the hands of their colonizers"?

elements.title: Prince Hubertus (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Prince Hubertus is the heir apparent to the head of the House of Saxe-Coburg and Gotha, a royal dynasty to which Elizabeth II belonged?

elements.title: Dariacore (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the album Dariacore took inspiration from Internet memes?

elements.title: Francis Fogarty (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Francis Fogarty, who went on to manage an NFL franchise for nearly two decades, was taken prisoner by the Nazis in World War II but managed to escape while wounded?

elements.title: "share" their wives with visitors (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that men of a Namibian tribe "share" their wives with visitors?
